title: What's News --  World-Wide
text:
The European Union charged Apple with antitrust violations over its control of music-streaming apps, broadening the battle over the tech giant's App Store practices.

---

Manhattan federal prosecutors are seeking to examine Giuliani's communications with an array of former Ukrainian officials, people familiar with the matter said.

---

The White House said that the U.S. will restrict travel from India beginning Tuesday, as concerns mount over a record surge in coronavirus cases there.

---

Biden intends to steer a middle course between the approaches of Trump and Obama on North Korea's nuclear and missile programs, U.S. officials said.

---

The U.S. criticized China's protection of intellectual property, saying that measures Beijing adopted -- some to comply with the 2020 U.S.-China trade deal -- don't go far enough.

---

3M lost the first lawsuit to go to trial over the safety of earplugs it sold for years to the military, with a federal jury awarding $7.1 million to three veterans.

---

Died: Eli Broad, 87, billionaire businessman, philanthropist and collector of contemporary art.
